question: name of the boundary line between india and bangladesh
api_result: The boundary line between India and Bangladesh is called the Radcliffe Line. It was named after Sir Cyril Radcliffe, who was the chairman of the Boundary Commissions for both Punjab and Bengal, tasked with equitably dividing British India into the two new nations of India and Pakistan in 1947. After the independence of Bangladesh from Pakistan in 1971, the Radcliffe Line became the border between India and Bangladesh.
